So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he <FI>was<Fi> righteous in his own eyes.<RF>to…: Heb. from answering<Rf>

Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.<RF>himself: Heb. his soul<Rf>
Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and <FI>yet<Fi> had condemned Job.
Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they <FI>were<Fi> elder than he.<RF>waited…: Heb. expected Job in words<Rf><RF>elder: Heb. elder for days<Rf>
When Elihu saw that <FI>there was<Fi> no answer in the mouth of <FI>these<Fi> three men, then his wrath was kindled.<CM>

And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I <FI>am<Fi> young, and ye <FI>are<Fi> very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.<RF>young: Heb. few of days<Rf><RF>durst…: Heb. feared<Rf>
I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
But <FI>there is<Fi> a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
Great men are not <FI>always<Fi> wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.<RF>reasons: Heb. understandings<Rf><RF>what…: Heb. words<Rf>
Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, <FI>there was<Fi> none of you that convinced Job, <FI>or<Fi> that answered his words:
Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
Now he hath not directed <FI>his<Fi> words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.<RF>directed: or, ordered<Rf><CM>
They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.<RF>left…: Heb. removed speeches from themselves<Rf>
When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, <FI>and<Fi> answered no more;)
<FI>I said<Fi>, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.<RF>matter: Heb. words<Rf><RF>spirit…: Heb. spirit of my belly<Rf>
Behold, my belly <FI>is<Fi> as wine <FI>which<Fi> hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.<RF>hath…: Heb. is not opened<Rf>
I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.<RF>be…: Heb. breathe<Rf>
Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
For I know not to give flattering titles; <FI>in so doing<Fi> my maker would soon take me away.<CM>
